titles.title: RELIEF Act

To amend the Act of August 18, 1941 (commonly known as the Flood Control Act of 1941), to allow a non-Federal sponsor to carry out certain work, to provide for reimbursement of costs to complete such work, and for other purposes.
RELIEF Act
Restoring the Efforts of Local Involvement in Emergencies and Floods Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.

bill.summary:
Restoring the Efforts of Local Involvement in Emergencies and Floods Act or the RELIEF Act
This bill authorizes the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers to reimburse nonfederal sponsors for work related to the emergency response to a natural disaster.
